issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
As #87854 reported, when HealthzBindAddresses is empty, there would be panic calling ProxierHealthServer#Updated().

This PR re-introduces the ProxierHealthUpdater variable to avoid panic.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
Fixes #87854

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

```release-note
NONE
```

**Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.**:



issue.title: kubeadm config images list: implement structured output

labels.name: cncf-cla: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has signed the CNCF CLA.

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

labels.name: needs-priority
labels.description: Indicates a PR lacks a `priority/foo` label and requires one.

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-cluster-lifecycle.

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind feature

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This is an implementation of kubeadm structured output described in this [KEP](https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/pull/1054) for ```kubeadm config images list``` command. It outputs image information in TEXT, JSON, YAML, Go template and JSONPATH formats.

Example output:

```
$ kubeadm config images list
k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/pause:3.1
k8s.gcr.io/etcd:3.4.3-0
k8s.gcr.io/coredns:1.6.5

$ kubeadm config images list -o json
{
    "kind": "Images",
    "apiVersion": "output.kubeadm.k8s.io/v1alpha1",
    "images": [
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver:v1.17.0",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager:v1.17.0",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler:v1.17.0",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy:v1.17.0",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/pause:3.1",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/etcd:3.4.3-0",
        },
        {
            "name": "k8s.gcr.io/coredns:1.6.5",
        }
    ]
}

$ kubeadm config images list -o yaml
apiVersion: output.kubeadm.k8s.io/v1alpha1
images:
- name: k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver:v1.17.0
- name: k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager:v1.17.0
- name: k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler:v1.17.0
- name: k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy:v1.17.0
- name: k8s.gcr.io/pause:3.1
- name: k8s.gcr.io/etcd:3.4.3-0
- name: k8s.gcr.io/coredns:1.6.5
kind: Images

$ kubeadm config images list -o 'go-template={{range .images}}{{.name}}{{"\n"}}{{end}}'
k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/pause:3.1
k8s.gcr.io/etcd:3.4.3-0
k8s.gcr.io/coredns:1.6.5

$ kubeadm config images list -o 'jsonpath={range.images[*]}{.name} {end}' | tr ' ' '\n'
k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy:v1.17.0
k8s.gcr.io/pause:3.1
k8s.gcr.io/etcd:3.4.3-0
k8s.gcr.io/coredns:1.6.5
```

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
```release-note
kubeadm: implemented structured output of 'kubeadm config images list' command in JSON, YAML, Go template and JsonPath formats
```

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug


**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Except should be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range, but currently it's allowed when the except value is supernet of the CIDR. For example, the following policy was accepted:
```
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: test-network-policy
  namespace: default
spec:
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      role: db
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress
  ingress:
  - from:
    - ipBlock:
        cidr: 192.168.0.0/24
        except:
        - 192.168.0.0/16
```
This patch enhances the validation.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.
_If PR is about `failing-tests or flakes`, please post the related issues/tests in a comment and do not use `Fixes`_*
-->
Fixes #

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".

For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->
```release-note
Fixed NetworkPolicy validation that Except values are accepted when they are outside the CIDR range.
```

**Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.**:

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files

Please use the following format for linking documentation:
- [KEP]: <link>
- [Usage]: <link>
- [Other doc]: <link>
-->
```docs

```

/kind design

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
If `pleg relist` runs between pause container  is ready and calling CNI to set IP,  pod status in `container.Cache` maybe expire.   
the subsequent creation of app container can will refresh the pod status. 
But if  App container creation failed, the status pause container maybe never have chance to refresh.

> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubelet/dockershim/docker_sandbox.go#L116`
add time.Sleep() and create pod with nonexistent image can recreate the bug

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:

- unworking test case in `TestRelisting` and `TestRelistingWithSandboxes`  in second `relist'
- duplicate calling `updateCache` of `podsToReinspect`  in one`relist`  when `updateCache` keeping returning err

issue.body:
<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
6. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What type of PR is this?**

/kind feature

/sig testing
/sig windows

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

Some images require a different ``Dockerfile`` for Windows images, since they have different ways of  installing dependencies. Because of this, if a image needs to be built for Windows, it will first check for a ``Dockerfile_windows`` file instead of the default one. If there isn't one, it means that the same ``Dockerfile``can be used for both Windows and Linux.

All Windows images will be based on the image "mcr.microsoft.com/windows/servercore:ltsc2019". There are a couple of features that are needed from this image, especially powershell.

Adds a README explaining the image building process, including the Windows Container image building process.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.

-->

-->
```release-note
Kubernetes E2E test image manifest lists now contain Windows images.
```

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What type of PR is this?**
/kind feature

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

This change introduces distinguishment between user supplied and kubeadm generated component configs. This distinguishment is necessary to provide seamless upgrades whenever kubeadm generated component configs are used and config version upgrade is required too. If a config is user supplied, it's not upgraded. Instead kubeadm bails out with an error message requiring a manual upgrade. If a config is deemed kubeadm generated it is thrown away and kubeadm generates a new one. That way users don't have to perform manual config upgrades whenever they expect kubeadm to manage them.

This particular implementation uses SHA256 checksums of config maps to implement the distinguishment. It's marked as a WIP as it needs some more comments and a few more tests. However, the basic functionality is all in there.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.
_If PR is about `failing-tests or flakes`, please post the related issues/tests in a comment and do not use `Fixes`_*
-->
Refs:
- kubernetes/kubeadm#1940
- kubernetes/enhancements#1381

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

This PR is part of the implementation of the new kubeadm component config management scheme KEP (see link below).

This PR is an alternative implementation of #86072 . Only one of these two needs to merge at some point. The other will be closed.

/cc @kubernetes/sig-cluster-lifecycle-pr-reviews
/area kubeadm
/priority important-longterm
/assign @timothysc @fabriziopandini @neolit123 @ereslibre 

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:

For more information on release notes see: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
-->
```release-note
kubeadm now distinguishes between generated and user supplied component configs, regenerating the former ones if a config upgrade is required
```

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
On a clean Windows installation, my PATH string ends with a ; (path separator on windows). This is normal and it's provided by Windows by default.

This PR changes plugin search so that it does not attempt to resolve empty strings or white-space-only strings that are in your path, so you won't get a warning message saying `Unable to read directory "" from your PATH: The system cannot find the file specified.. Skipping...`

I also fixed a problem where multiple (legitimate) directory not found warnings are not getting newlines and were running together.

I also fixed a bug in the same function where the normal message `The following compatible plugins are available:` was accidentally being written to stderr instead of stdout.

I added a unit test case and also manually verified the fix in kubectl on both linux and windows.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
fixes https://github.com/kubernetes/kubectl/issues/792

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
Example of old behavior...
```
$ kubectl plugin list
Unable read directory "" from your PATH: open : no such file or directory. Skipping...
error: unable to find any kubectl plugins in your PATH
```

New message after this fix...
```
$ kubectl plugin list
error: unable to find any kubectl plugins in your PATH
```


**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
```release-note
Prevent error message from being displayed when running kubectl plugin list and your path includes an empty string
```

**Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.**:
n/a

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
On a clean Windows installation, my PATH string ends with a ; (path separator on windows). This is normal and it's provided by Windows by default.

This PR changes plugin search so that it does not attempt to resolve empty strings or white-space-only strings that are in your path, so you won't get a warning message saying `Unable to read directory "" from your PATH: The system cannot find the file specified.. Skipping...`

I also fixed a problem where multiple (legitimate) directory not found warnings are not getting newlines and were running together.

I also fixed a bug in the same function where the normal message `The following compatible plugins are available:` was accidentally being written to stderr instead of stdout.

I added a unit test case and also manually verified the fix in kubectl on both linux and windows.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
fixes https://github.com/kubernetes/kubectl/issues/792

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
Example of old behavior...
```
$ kubectl plugin list
Unable read directory "" from your PATH: open : no such file or directory. Skipping...
error: unable to find any kubectl plugins in your PATH
```

New message after this fix...
```
$ kubectl plugin list
error: unable to find any kubectl plugins in your PATH
```


**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
```release-note
Prevent error message from being displayed when running kubectl plugin list and your path includes an empty string
```

**Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.**:
n/a

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
As #87806 reported, csiDriverClient#NodeGetInfo would crash calling getNodeInfoError.Error() because getNodeInfoError may be nil.

The cloud provider may not give facility for determining the cause of error when kubelet segfault's

This PR adds check for getNodeInfoError against nil.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
Fixes #87806

<!--  Thanks for sending a pull request!  Here are some tips for you:

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label
3. Ensure you have added or ran the appropriate tests for your PR: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-testing/testing.md
4. If you want *faster* PR reviews, read how: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#best-practices-for-faster-reviews
5. Follow the instructions for writing a release note: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/release-notes.md
6. If the PR is unfinished, see how to mark it: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md#marking-unfinished-pull-requests
-->

**What type of PR is this?**

/kind bug
/kind design

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
If `pleg relist` runs between pause container  is ready and calling CNI to set IP,  pod status in `container.Cache` maybe expire.   
the subsequent creation of app container can will refresh the pod status. 
But if  App container creation failed, the status pause container maybe never have chance to refresh.

> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/kubelet/dockershim/docker_sandbox.go#L116`
add time.Sleep() and create pod with nonexistent image can recreate the bug

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.
_If PR is about `failing-tests or flakes`, please post the related issues/tests in a comment and do not use `Fixes`_*
-->
Fixes #https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/82754
tidy fix：

- unworking test case in `TestRelisting` and `TestRelistingWithSandboxes`  in second `relist'
- duplicate calling `updateCache` of `podsToReinspect`  in one`relist`  when `updateCache` keeping returning err

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
-->
```release-note
NONE
```

**Additional documentation e.g., KEPs (Kubernetes Enhancement Proposals), usage docs, etc.**:

<!--
This section can be blank if this pull request does not require a release note.

When adding links which point to resources within git repositories, like
KEPs or supporting documentation, please reference a specific commit and avoid
linking directly to the master branch. This ensures that links reference a
specific point in time, rather than a document that may change over time.

See here for guidance on getting permanent links to files: https://help.github.com/en/articles/getting-permanent-links-to-files

Please use the following format for linking documentation:
- [KEP]: <link>
- [Usage]: <link>
- [Other doc]: <link>
-->
```docs

```
/sig node

the subsequent creation of app container can will refresh the pod status.

add time.Sleep() and create pod with nonexistent image can recreate the bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-auth.

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-node.

labels.name: sig/testing
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-testing.

labels.name: size/L

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind feature

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
This PR is intended to allow client certificate rotation from disk. It attempts to handle the connection restarting (on rotation) logic in a generic way, such that it can apply to all certificate callbacks. The complexity mainly arises from trying to handle the case where a certificate expires for an open connection, which is a real issue given that the apiserver verifies on every request, and connections tend to be highly reused.

1. Change the default behaviour when certificate files are specified, to create a `GetCert` function which always loads the cert off disk. Given that new TCP connections seem to be created fairly rarely, this might be an appropriate long term solution, or otherwise we can add some kind of caching with a file watch. We may also want to introduce a feature gate or to otherwise control this behaviour, although I think it's a fairly safe default - we don't guarantee that we'll only read the certificate on first boot.
2. Add generic behaviour to the transport creation functions when using a `GetCert` function which notes any change in the returned certificate, closing all connections when doing so. Additionally, we check for new certificates every 5 minutes. Together these two behaviours should cover the possibility of certs expiring while connections are open, causing unauthorised errors.
3. Given the new default behaviour when using `GetCert`, we no longer need the connrotation logic in the exec auth callback. 

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
<!--
*Automatically closes linked issue when PR is merged.
Usage: `Fixes #<issue number>`, or `Fixes (paste link of issue)`.
_If PR is about `failing-tests or flakes`, please post the related issues/tests in a comment and do not use `Fixes`_*
-->
Fixes #4672

**Special notes for your reviewer**:
This approach was discussed briefly in the June 12th 2019 sig auth meeting - watching that could be useful context. This is only one possible approach (eg, we could use a custom roundtripper instead) and I am very open to ideas.

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:
<!--
If no, just write "NONE" in the release-note block below.
If yes, a release note is required:
Enter your extended release note in the block below. If the PR requires additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required".
-->
```release-note
When client certificate files are provided, always reload files from disk for new connections, and close connections when a certificate changes.
```

issue.title: Defaulting seems to be broken for autoscaling/v2beta2 api group

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: priority/important-soon
labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.

labels.name: sig/autoscaling
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-autoscaling.

issue.body:
This function is defined and not used anywhere:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/autoscaling/v2beta2/defaults.go#L30

The reason seem to be the missing tag here:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/pkg/apis/autoscaling/v2beta2/doc.go#L18

```
// +k8s:defaulter-gen-input=../../../../vendor/k8s.io/api/autoscaling/v2beta2
```

That said - it seems to be causing some test failures.

Please take a look and fix.

@kubernetes/sig-autoscaling-bugs 
@josephburnett

**What type of PR is this?**

/kind bug

/sig testing
/area conformance

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

Image Centralization part 4 merged, which centralized other images into ``agnhost``, including ``test-webserver``. The ``kitten`` and ``nautilus`` images were based on the ``test-webserver`` image, but right now, they're built on top of ``agnhost:2.7``, but due to a few other merges, the image version in which the Image Centralization part 4 merged was 2.9, but the ``nautilus`` and ``kitten`` images were not updated properly.

Bumps the ``agnhost`` version in the ``kitten`` and ``nautilus`` ``BASEIMAGE`` files.

issue.title: Add annotation updating for migration for PVs and PVCs

labels.name: approved
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by an approver from all required OWNERS files.

labels.name: cncf-cla: yes
labels.description: Indicates the PR's author has signed the CNCF CLA.

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: lgtm
labels.description: Indicates that a PR is ready to be merged.

labels.name: priority/critical-urgent
labels.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.

labels.name: release-note
labels.description: Denotes a PR that will be considered when it comes time to generate release notes.

labels.name: sig/apps
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-apps.

labels.name: sig/storage
labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to sig-storage.

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
Add annotation annealing for migration for PVs and PVCs  on PV Controller startup. This allows external-provisioners to pick up and delete volumes when they have been rolled up from previous kubernetes versions.

Side note:
When externally provisioning the `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-provisioner` annotation on the PVC was changed to the CSI Driver name during migration (since the introduction of CSI Migration feature). With this new addition of the `migrated-to` annotation it was possible to revert the `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-provisioner` annotation to back to the in-tree plugin during migration for conceptual consistency. However, we determined that would be a breaking change to the Beta Migration feature and would cause additional headaches in terms of version compatability of external provisioners.

/assign @msau42 @misterikkit @ddebroy 
/cc @leakingtapan 

/kind bug
 
k8s/k8s part of solution for: #79043 

```release-note
Adds "volume.beta.kubernetes.io/migrated-to" annotation to PV's and PVC's when they are migrated to signal external provisioners to pick up those objects for Provisioning and Deleting. 
```

issue.body:
Add annotation annealing for migration for PVs and PVCs  on PV Controller startup. This allows external-provisioners to pick up and delete volumes when they have been rolled up from previous kubernetes versions.

Side note:
When externally provisioning the `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-provisioner` annotation on the PVC was changed to the CSI Driver name during migration (since the introduction of CSI Migration feature). With this new addition of the `migrated-to` annotation it was possible to revert the `volume.beta.kubernetes.io/storage-provisioner` annotation to back to the in-tree plugin during migration for conceptual consistency. However, we determined that would be a breaking change to the Beta Migration feature and would cause additional headaches in terms of version compatability of external provisioners.

/assign @msau42 @misterikkit @ddebroy 
/cc @leakingtapan 

/kind bug
 
k8s/k8s part of solution for: #79043 

```release-note
Adds "volume.beta.kubernetes.io/migrated-to" annotation to PV's and PVC's when they are migrated to signal external provisioners to pick up those objects for Provisioning and Deleting. 
```

**What type of PR is this?**

OOM constants. One set the oom adj for sandbox docker containers and the
other set the oom adj for the docker daemon. Move both to be closer to
their actual usages in `dockershim`.

making `pkg/kubelet` runtime agnostic except for `dockershim`.

1. If this is your first time, please read our contributor guidelines: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide#your-first-contribution and developer guide https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/development.md#development-guide
2. Please label this pull request according to what type of issue you are addressing, especially if this is a release targeted pull request. For reference on required PR/issue labels, read here:
https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-release/release.md#issuepr-kind-label

**What type of PR is this?**

/kind feature

/sig testing
/sig windows

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

Some images require a different ``Dockerfile`` for Windows images, since they have different ways of  installing dependencies. Because of this, if a image needs to be built for Windows, it will first check for a ``Dockerfile_windows`` file instead of the default one. If there isn't one, it means that the same ``Dockerfile``can be used for both Windows and Linux.

All Windows images will be based on the image "mcr.microsoft.com/windows/servercore:ltsc2019". There are a couple of features that are needed from this image, especially powershell.

Adds a README explaining the image building process, including the Windows Container image building process.

so we can be sure we create a link in /usr/local/bin which is in default PATH

**What type of PR is this?**

The background is discussed at #87632 

In short, all scheduler (filter) plugins take terminating Pods into consideration, however, for some particular case (e.g., PodTopologySpread), it may be reasonable to exclude the terminating Pods.

```release-note
PodTopologySpread plugin now excludes terminatingPods when making scheduling decisions.
```

**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug


**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Except should be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range, but currently it's allowed when the except value is supernet of the CIDR. For example, the following policy was accepted:
```
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: test-network-policy
  namespace: default
spec:
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      role: db
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress
  ingress:
  - from:
    - ipBlock:
        cidr: 192.168.0.0/24
        except:
        - 192.168.0.0/16
```
This patch enhances the validation.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:

-->

**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug


**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Except should be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range, but currently it's allowed when the except value is supernet of the CIDR. For example, the following policy was accepted:
```
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: test-network-policy
  namespace: default
spec:
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      role: db
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress
  ingress:
  - from:
    - ipBlock:
        cidr: 192.168.0.0/24
        except:
        - 192.168.0.0/16
```
This patch enhances the validation.

issue.body:
Currently, if you have a PDB set, it is possible for
a pod stuck in pending state to be prevented from
deletion even though there are in fact enough healthy
replicas.

This commit allows pods in Pending state to be removed.

This commit also adds associated unit tests.

Fixes: #80389

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
Except should be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range, but currently it's allowed when the except value is supernet of the CIDR. For example, the following policy was accepted:
```
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: test-network-policy
  namespace: default
spec:
  podSelector:
    matchLabels:
      role: db
  policyTypes:
  - Ingress
  ingress:
  - from:
    - ipBlock:
        cidr: 192.168.0.0/24
        except:
        - 192.168.0.0/16
```

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**

/kind feature
/sig scheduling

**What this PR does / why we need it**:

The background is discussed at #87632 

In short, all scheduler (filter) plugins take terminating Pods into consideration, however, for some particular case (e.g., PodTopologySpread), it may be reasonable to exclude the terminating Pods.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:

Fixes #86037

**Special notes for your reviewer**:

**Does this PR introduce a user-facing change?**:

```release-note
PodTopologySpread plugin now excludes terminatingPods when making scheduling decisions.
```

/cc @ahg-g @alculquicondor

issue.body:
**What type of PR is this?**
/kind bug

**What this PR does / why we need it**:
As #87806 reported, csiDriverClient#NodeGetInfo would crash calling getNodeInfoError.Error() because getNodeInfoError may be nil.

The cloud provider may not give facility for determining the cause of error when kubelet segfault's

This PR adds check for getNodeInfoError against nil.

**Which issue(s) this PR fixes**:
Fixes #87806

```release-note
NONE
```
